articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Vietnamese Party Delegation
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Vietnamese Party Delegation
						

					Pyongyang, October 21 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a talk with the delegation of the Communist Party of Vietnam led by Hoang Binh Quan, chairman of the Commission for External Affairs of the Party Central Committee, which paid a courtesy call on him at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Friday.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Il from Head of CPV Delegation
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il from Head of Vietnamese Party Delegation 
						

					 Pyongyang, October 21 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a gift from the head of the visiting delegation of the Communist Party of Vietnam.
					
					 The gift was handed to Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, by Hoang Binh Quan, chairman of the Commission for External Affairs of the Party Central Committee who is heading the delegation, on Friday.

articles.title: Talks Held between WPK, CPV Delegations
articles.content:
Talks Held between WPK, CPV Delegations
						

					 Pyongyang, October 21 (KCNA) -- Talks between delegations of the Workers' Party of Korea and the Communist Party of Vietnam were held in Pyongyang on Friday.
					
					 Present there from the WPK side were Kim Yong Il, secretary of the C.C., WPK, Vice Department Director Pak Kun Gwang and other officials of the WPK Central Committee and from the opposite side were members of the CPV delegation led by Hoang Binh Quan, chairman of the Commission for External Affairs of the Party Central Committee, and Le Quang Ba, Vietnamese ambassador to the DPRK.
					
					 At the talks both sides informed each other of their party activities and exchanged views on the matter of further developing the relations between the two parties.
					
					 The talks proceeded in a friendly atmosphere.
